title: AP: Harvard scientists warn multi-billion research freeze could cause lasting damage
summary: Trump administration froze $2.2B grants plus $60M contracts to Harvard after university rejected federal demands. 46% of public health budget affected, researchers laying off staff, decades of research shelved. Harvard filed federal lawsuit alleging retaliation campaign.
notes: Freeze began April 2025 after Harvard refused administration demands. 7th elite college targeted, 6 of 7 Ivy League. $110M NIH grants halted since Feb. $60M tuberculosis consortium interrupted. Harvard filed lawsuit claiming constitutional violations. Part of $11B cuts to 24+ institutions.
